SVC syndrome: A condition in which blood clots form in the superior vena cava, a large vein that carries blood from the head, neck, and upper body to the heart.

HITT: Hypereosinophilic syndrome with thrombocytopenia, a rare blood disorder characterized by an abnormal increase in the number of eosinophils (a type of white blood cell) and a low platelet count.
